CHI 660E electrochemical system, electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) was collected in a three-electrode cell with Pt and AgAgCl as the counter electrode and the reference electrode, respectively. The photocatalytic CO2 performance of bulk Bi2Sn2O7 and Bi2Sn2O7 NPs were examined by a 500 mL Labsolar-6A closed gas system (Perfectlight, China).Specifically, 20 mg samples were well dispersed into 50 mL water.Before the measurement, the system was degassed and repumped into high purity CO2 with a pressure

high purity CO2 with a pressure of 0.08 MPa.A 300 W Xe lamp (Microsolar300, Perfectlight) was amounted as light source simulating solar light irradiation.The test was carried out at about 5 o C and products were detected by gas chromatograph (Cotrun GC2002, FID).The apparent quantum efficiency of CO is calculated via the following equation: apparent quantum efficiency (amount of generated CO 2)amount of incident photons 100.The carbon source of CO was identified by 13 C isotopic labeling experiment using

two samples exhibited high selectivity (over 99) with CO as the dominant product, accompanied by a negligible amount of methane.As shown in Figure 3a, greatly improved CO formation rate can be observed over Bi2Sn2O7 NPs with an average rate of 14.88 mol g -1 h -1 , roughly 8.1 times the amount of that of the bulk counterpart (1.83 mol g -1 h -1 ).This value is comparable to or superior to state-of-the-art reported results (Table S1).The apparent quantum efficiency of Bi2Sn2O7 NPs at 380 and 400 nm are

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.

Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: high purity CO2 with a pressure of 0.08 MPa.A 300 W Xe lamp (Microsolar300, Perfectlight) was amounted as light source simulating solar light irradiation.The test was carried out at about 5 o C and products were detected by gas chromatograph (Cotrun GC2002, FID).The apparent quantum efficiency of CO is calculated via the following equation: apparent quantum efficiency (amount of generated CO 2)amount of incident photons 100.The carbon source of CO was identified by 13 C isotopic labeling experiment using

at 77 K.The chemical states and energy band structures of obtained samples were analyzed by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (Kratos AXIS Supra XPS with a monochromatic Al-K source) and ultraviolet photoemission spectroscopy (UPS).Bi L1-edge (eV) XAFS spectra were recorded at the beamline 14W1 of the Shanghai Synchrotron Radiation Facility, China.UVvis spectra were recorded on a PerkinElmer Lambda950 spectrophotometer.In-situ Fourier transfer infrared spectra (FTIR) were obtained via a Bruker vertex 70.The

labeling experiment using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (7890A and 5975C, Agilent).
